## StackLayout Usage Guide
[**üöÄ 8.9 Released!** ‚Üí ‚ö°Ô∏è New Node-API Engine Preview, üì≤ ns widget ios, üíÖ Tailwind v4 and more...\\
Read Announcement‚Üí](https://blog.nativescript.org/nativescript-8-9-announcement)

Menu

- [Docs](https://docs.nativescript.org/)
- [Tutorials](https://docs.nativescript.org/tutorials/)
- [Preview](https://preview.nativescript.org/)
- [Snacks](https://docs.nativescript.org/snacks/)
- [Plugins](https://docs.nativescript.org/plugins/)
- [UI Components](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/)
- [API Reference](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/)

- [Layout Containers](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/#layout-containers)
  - [StackLayout](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/stack-layout)
  - [GridLayout](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/grid-layout)
  - [RootLayout](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/root-layout)
  - [FlexboxLayout](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/flexbox-layout)
  - [WrapLayout](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/wrap-layout)
  - [DockLayout](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/dock-layout)
  - [AbsoluteLayout](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/absolute-layout)
- [Navigation Components](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/#navigation-containers)
  - [Frame](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/frame)
  - [Page](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/page)
  - [ActionBar](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/action-bar)
- [Dialogs](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/dialogs)
  - [Alert](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/dialogs#alert)
  - [Action](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/dialogs#action)
  - [Confirm](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/dialogs#confirm)
  - [Prompt](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/dialogs#prompt)
  - [Login](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/dialogs#login)
- [Components](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/#components)
  - [ActivityIndicator](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/activity-indicator)
  - [Button](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/button)
  - [DatePicker](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/date-picker)
  - [HtmlView](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/html-view)
  - [Image](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/image)
  - [Label](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/label)
  - [ListPicker](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/list-picker)
  - [ListView](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/list-view)
  - [Placeholder](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/placeholder)
  - [Progress](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/progress)
  - [ScrollView](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/scroll-view)
  - [SearchBar](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/search-bar)
  - [SegmentedBar](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/segmented-bar)
  - [Slider](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/slider)
  - [Switch](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/switch)
  - [TabView](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/tab-view)
  - [TextField](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-field)
  - [TextView](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-view)
  - [TimePicker](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/time-picker)
  - [WebView](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/web-view)

When you add child views to a StackLayout, they will be arranged one after the other in the specified direction, either horizontally or vertically. By default, the orientation of a StackLayout is vertical, but you can change it to `horizontal` by setting the `orientation` property.

Important

StackLayout is a basic layout container often used excessively in complex layouts. Overusing it with many nested containers or numerous child views can result in poor performance and slow rendering. If you're extensively nesting `<StackLayout>`, consider switching to [`<GridLayout>`](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/grid-layout) or [`<FlexboxLayout>`](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/flexbox-layout) for better performance.

## Examples [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/stack-layout\#examples)

### Vertical StackLayout [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/stack-layout\#vertical-stacklayout)

By default, `<StackLayout>` stacks its child items vertically. The following example creates a vertical StackLayout of 3 equally-sized elements. Items are stretched to cover the entire width of the screen. Items are placed in the order they were declared in.

xml

```
<StackLayout backgroundColor="#3c495e">
  <Label text="first" height="70" backgroundColor="#43B3F4" />
  <Label text="second" height="70" backgroundColor="#1089CA" />
  <Label text="third" height="70" backgroundColor="#075B88" />
</StackLayout>
```

![](https://art.nativescript.org/layouts/stack_layout_vertical.svg)

### Aligning children horizontally in a veritcal StackLayout [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/stack-layout\#aligning-children-horizontally-in-a-veritcal-stacklayout)

Child elements of a vertical StackLayout can align themselves horizontally at `left`, `center` or `right` positions with the `horizontalAlignment` property.

For example, we can align child elements diagonally in a vertical StackLayout.

xml

```
<StackLayout backgroundColor="#3c495e">
  <Label
    text="left"
    horizontalAlignment="left"
    width="33%"
    height="70"
    backgroundColor="#43B3F4"
  />
  <Label
    text="center"
    horizontalAlignment="center"
    width="33%"
    height="70"
    backgroundColor="#1089CA"
  />
  <Label
    text="right"
    horizontalAlignment="right"
    width="33%"
    height="70"
    backgroundColor="#075B88"
  />
  <Label
    text="stretch"
    horizontalAlignment="stretch"
    height="70"
    backgroundColor="#43B3F4"
  />
</StackLayout>
```

![](https://art.nativescript.org/layouts/stack_layout_vertical_align_children.svg)

### Horizontal StackLayout [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/stack-layout\#horizontal-stacklayout)

Setting `orientation="horizontal"` on the `StackLayout` will stack items horizontally. The following example creates a horizontal StackLayout of 3 equally-sized elements. Items are stretched to cover the entire height of the screen.

xml

```
<StackLayout orientation="horizontal" backgroundColor="#3c495e">
  <Label text="first" width="70" backgroundColor="#43B3F4" />
  <Label text="second" width="70" backgroundColor="#1089CA" />
  <Label text="third" width="70" backgroundColor="#075B88" />
</StackLayout>
```

![](https://art.nativescript.org/layouts/stack_layout_horizontal.svg)

### Aligning children vertically in a horizontal StackLayout [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/stack-layout\#aligning-children-vertically-in-a-horizontal-stacklayout)

Child elements of a horizontal StackLayout can align themselves veritcally at `top`, `center` or `bottom` positions with the `verticalAlignment` property. The following example creates a diagonal stack of items with responsive sizes.

xml

```
<StackLayout orientation="horizontal" backgroundColor="#3c495e">
  <Label
    text="top"
    verticalAlignment="top"
    width="70"
    height="33%"
    backgroundColor="#43B3F4"
  />
  <Label
    text="center"
    verticalAlignment="center"
    width="70"
    height="33%"
    backgroundColor="#1089CA"
  />
  <Label
    text="bottom"
    verticalAlignment="bottom"
    width="70"
    height="33%"
    backgroundColor="#075B88"
  />
  <Label
    text="stretch"
    verticalAlignment="stretch"
    width="70"
    backgroundColor="#43B3F4"
  />
</StackLayout>
```

![](https://art.nativescript.org/layouts/stack_layout_horizontal_align_children.svg)

## Props [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/stack-layout\#props)

### orientation [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/stack-layout\#orientation)

ts

```
orientation: string = 'vertical' | 'horizontal'
```

Specifies the direction of child elements in the StackLayout.

Valid values: `vertical` and `horizontal`.

Default value: `vertical`.

### ...Inherited [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/stack-layout\#inherited)

Additional inherited properties not shown. Refer to the [API Reference](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/class/StackLayout)

Next [GridLayout‚Üí](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/grid-layout)

2. [Aligning children horizontally in a veritcal StackLayout](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/stack-layout#aligning-children-horizontally-in-a-veritcal-stacklayout)
3. [Horizontal StackLayout](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/stack-layout#horizontal-stacklayout)
4. [Aligning children vertically in a horizontal StackLayout](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/stack-layout#aligning-children-vertically-in-a-horizontal-stacklayout)
3. [Props](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/stack-layout#props)

## SearchBar Component Guide

Menu

- [Docs](https://docs.nativescript.org/)

  - [ActionBar](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/action-bar)

  - [Alert](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/dialogs#alert)
  - [Action](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/dialogs#action)
  - [Confirm](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/dialogs#confirm)
  - [Prompt](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/dialogs#prompt)
  - [Login](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/dialogs#login)
- [Components](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/#components)
  - [ActivityIndicator](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/activity-indicator)
  - [Button](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/button)
  - [DatePicker](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/date-picker)
  - [HtmlView](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/html-view)
  - [Image](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/image)
  - [Label](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/label)
  - [ListPicker](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/list-picker)
  - [ListView](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/list-view)

  - [Progress](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/progress)
  - [ScrollView](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/scroll-view)
  - [SearchBar](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/search-bar)
  - [SegmentedBar](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/segmented-bar)
  - [Slider](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/slider)
  - [Switch](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/switch)
  - [TabView](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/tab-view)
  - [TextField](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-field)
  - [TextView](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-view)
  - [TimePicker](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/time-picker)
  - [WebView](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/web-view)

`<SearchBar>` is a UI component that provides a user interface for entering search queries.

![](https://docs.nativescript.org/assets/SearchBar.fff5dedb.png)

![](https://docs.nativescript.org/assets/SearchBar.9f5bab3c.png)

TypeScript
TypeScript
Angular
Angular
Vue.js
Vue
Svelte
Svelte
Solid
Solid
React
React

xml

```
<SearchBar hint="Search..." />
```

html

```
<SearchBar hint="Search..." />
```

tsx

```
<searchBar hint="Search..."></searchBar>
```

tsx

```
<searchbar hint="Search..."></searchbar>
```

svelte

```
<searchBar hint="Search..."></searchBar>
```

vue

```
<SearchBar hint="Search..." />
```

## Props [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/search-bar\#props)

### hint [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/search-bar\#hint)

ts

```
hint: string
```

Gets or sets the placeholder text for the input area.

### text [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/search-bar\#text)

ts

```
text: string
```

Gets or sets the value of the search query.

### textFieldBackgroundColor [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/search-bar\#textfieldbackgroundcolor)

ts

```
textFieldBackgroundColor: Color
```

Gets or sets the background color of the input area.

See [Color](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/class/Color).

### textFieldHintColor [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/search-bar\#textfieldhintcolor)

ts

```
textFieldHintColor: Color
```

Gets or sets the color of the placeholder text.

See [Color](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/class/Color).

### ...Inherited [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/search-bar\#inherited)

For additional inherited properties, refer to the [API Reference](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/class/SearchBar)

## Events [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/search-bar\#events)

### textChange [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/search-bar\#textchange)

ts

```
on('textChange', (args: PropertyChangeData) => {
  const searchBar = args.object as SearchBar
  console.log('Search query:', args.value)
})
```

Emitted when the search text is changed.

See [PropertyChangeData](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/interface/PropertyChangeData).

### submit [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/search-bar\#submit)

ts

```
on('submit', (args: EventData) => {
  const searchBar = args.object as SearchBar
  console.log('Search for:', searchBar.text)
})
```

Emitted when the search text is submitted.

### clear [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/search-bar\#clear)

ts

```
on('submit', (args: EventData) => {
  const searchBar = args.object as SearchBar
  console.log('SearchBar cleared')
})
```

Emitted when the search input is cleared through the **‚úó** button in the input area.

## Native component [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/search-bar\#native-component)

- Android: [`android.widget.SearchView`](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/widget/SearchView.html)
- iOS: [`UISearchBar`](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/uikit/uisearchbar)

Previous [‚ÜêScrollView](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/scroll-view)

Next [SegmentedBar‚Üí](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/segmented-bar)

3. [textFieldBackgroundColor](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/search-bar#textfieldbackgroundcolor)
4. [textFieldHintColor](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/search-bar#textfieldhintcolor)
5. [...Inherited](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/search-bar#inherited)
3. [Events](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/search-bar#events)

Just like you can Preview iOS and Android apps using StackBlitz with [NativeScript Preview](https://preview.nativescript.org/), you can do the same with visionOS apps.

![Previewing visionOS from StackBlitz](https://docs.nativescript.org/assets/nativescript-visionpro-stackblitz.b58e1fcb.jpg)

## Using NativeScript Preview with Vision Pro [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/guide/visionos-preview\#using-nativescript-preview-with-vision-pro)

_This is useful if you have a physical Vision Pro device._

1. On your Vision Pro
   - Search for and install "NativeScript Preview" on the App Store.
2. On your desktop
1. Start a StackBlitz session containing a Vision Pro app like this one: [https://stackblitz.com/edit/nativescript-vision-pro-explore?file=src%2Fapp%2Fitem%2Fitems.component.ts](https://stackblitz.com/edit/nativescript-vision-pro-explore?file=src%2Fapp%2Fitem%2Fitems.component.ts)
      - _Tip: You can also share your desktop to your Vision Pro to copy/paste links directly._
2. Once QR Code appears on the right side, you can CMD+Tap on the QR to open a new browser tab.
3. Copy/Paste the URL from the new browser tab
4. Share this URL with your Vision Pro
3. Back on your Vision Pro
1. Tapping on the shared link will open NativeScript Preview and begin building in the StackBlitz terminal.
2. Once the build is complete, Vision Pro Safari will launch with a prompt to open 'Preview' on the Vision Pro to begin a live development session with your Vision Pro app.

Previous [‚ÜêDeveloping with visionOS](https://docs.nativescript.org/guide/visionos)

Next [Adding Native Code‚Üí](https://docs.nativescript.org/guide/adding-native-code)

On this page

1. ‚Üë Top
2. [Using NativeScript Preview with Vision Pro](https://docs.nativescript.org/guide/visionos-preview#using-nativescript-preview-with-vision-pro)

### InstrumentationMode [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/\#instrumentationmode)

```
InstrumentationMode: "counters" | "timeline" | "lifecycle"
```

defined in [@nativescript/core/profiling/index.d.ts:17:5](https://unpkg.com/browse/@nativescript/core//profiling/index.d.ts#L17)

Profiling mode to use.
\- `` `counters` `` Accumulates method call counts and times until dumpProfiles is called and then prints aggregated statistic in the console. This is the default.
\- `` `timeline` `` Outputs method names along start/end timestamps in the console on the go.
\- `` `lifecycle` `` Outputs basic non-verbose times for startup, navigation, etc.

## Functions [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/\#functions)

### CSSType [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/\#csstype)

```
CSSType(type: string): ClassDecorator
```

defined in [@nativescript/core/ui/core/view/index.d.ts:36](https://unpkg.com/browse/@nativescript/core//ui/core/view/index.d.ts#L36)

Specifies the type name for the instances of this View class,
that is used when matching CSS type selectors.

Usage:
```` ```
@CSSType("Button")
class Button extends View {
}
``` ````

Internally the decorator set `` `Button.prototype.cssType = "Button"` ``.

|     |     |     |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Parameter | Default | Description |
| `type` | `` | `string`<br>The type name, e. g. "Button", "Label", etc. |

Returns _ClassDecorator_

### login [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/\#login)

```
login(message: string, userNameHint?: string, passwordHint?: string, userName?: string, password?: string): Promise<LoginResult>
```

defined in [@nativescript/core/ui/dialogs/index.d.ts:107](https://unpkg.com/browse/@nativescript/core//ui/dialogs/index.d.ts#L107)

The login() method displays a login dialog box that prompts the visitor for user name and password.

|     |     |     |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Parameter | Default | Description |
| `message` | `` | `string`<br>The text to display in the dialog box. |
| `userNameHint` | `` | `string`<br>The default text to display as a hint in the username input. Optional. |
| `passwordHint` | `` | `string`<br>The default text to display as a hint in the password input. Optional. |
| `userName` | `` | `string`<br>The default text to display in the user name input box. Optional. |
| `password` | `` | `string`<br>The default text to display in the password input box. Optional. |

Returns _Promise< [LoginResult](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/interface/LoginResult) >_

```

### profile [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/\#profile)

profile(name?: string): MethodDecorator
```

defined in [@nativescript/core/profiling/index.d.ts:98](https://unpkg.com/browse/@nativescript/core//profiling/index.d.ts#L98)

Method decorator factory. It will intercept the method call and start and pause a timer before and after the method call.
Works only if profiling is enabled.

|     |     |     |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Parameter | Default | Description |
| `name` | `` | `string`<br>Name of the timer which will be used for method calls. If not provided - the name of the method will be used. |

Returns _MethodDecorator_

Function factory. It will intercept the function call and start and pause a timer before and after the function call. Works only if profiling is enabled.
Works only if profiling is enabled.

|     |     |     |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Parameter | Default | Description |
| `fn` | `` | `F`<br>The function to wrap. Uses the function name to track the times. |

profilingDumpProfiles(): void

### profilingEnable [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/\#profilingenable)

```
profilingEnable(type?: InstrumentationMode): void
```

defined in [@nativescript/core/profiling/index.d.ts:53](https://unpkg.com/browse/@nativescript/core//profiling/index.d.ts#L53)

Enables profiling.

Upon loading of the module it will cache the package.json of the app and check if there is a "profiling" key set,
its value can be one of the options available for InstrumentationMode, and if set,
enable() will be called in pre app start with the value in the package.json.

An example for an `` `app/package.json` `` enabling the manual instrumentation profiling is:
```` ```
{
    "main": "main.js",
    "profiling": "timeline"
}
``` ````

|     |     |     |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Parameter | Default | Description |
| `type` | `` | `InstrumentationMode`<br>Profiling mode to use.<br>\- "counters" - Accumulates method call counts and times until dumpProfiles is called and then prints aggregated statistic in the console. This is the default.<br>\- "timeline" - Outputs method names along start/end timestamps in the console on the go.<br>\- "lifecycle" - Outputs basic non-verbose times for startup, navigation, etc. |

Returns _void_

## TabView UI Component
[**üöÄ 8.9 Released!** ‚Üí ‚ö°Ô∏è New Node-API Engine Preview, üì≤ ns widget ios, üíÖ Tailwind v4 and more...\\
Read Announcement‚Üí](https://blog.nativescript.org/nativescript-8-9-announcement)

Menu

- [Plugins](https://docs.nativescript.org/plugins/)
- [UI Components](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/)
- [API Reference](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/)

- [Layout Containers](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/#layout-containers)

  - [WrapLayout](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/wrap-layout)

  - [Prompt](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/dialogs#prompt)
  - [Login](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/dialogs#login)

  - [DatePicker](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/date-picker)

  - [Image](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/image)

  - [ListPicker](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/list-picker)

  - [Progress](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/progress)

  - [SearchBar](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/search-bar)
  - [SegmentedBar](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/segmented-bar)
  - [Slider](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/slider)
  - [Switch](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/switch)
  - [TabView](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/tab-view)
  - [TextField](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-field)
  - [TextView](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-view)
  - [TimePicker](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/time-picker)
  - [WebView](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/web-view)

`<TabView>` is a UI component that shows content grouped into tabs and lets users switch between them.

![](https://docs.nativescript.org/assets/TabView.d0fd0920.png)

![](https://docs.nativescript.org/assets/TabView.2ddf2d92.png)

TypeScript
TypeScript
Angular
Angular
Vue.js
Vue
Svelte
Svelte
Solid
Solid
React
React

xml

```
<TabView>
  <TabViewItem title="First">
    <Label text="First Tab Content" textAlignment="center" verticalAlignment="center" />
  </TabViewItem>
  <TabViewItem title="Second">
    <Label text="Second Tab Content" textAlignment="center" verticalAlignment="center" />
  </TabViewItem>
  <TabViewItem title="Third">
    <Label text="Third Tab Content" textAlignment="center" verticalAlignment="center" />
  </TabViewItem>
</TabView>
```

html

```
<TabView>
  <StackLayout *tabItem="{title: 'First'}">
    <GridLayout>
      <ContentView verticalAlignment="center" horizontalAlignment="center">
        <label text="First Tab Content"></label>
      </ContentView>
    </GridLayout>
  </StackLayout>
  <StackLayout *tabItem="{title: 'Second'}">
    <GridLayout>
      <ContentView verticalAlignment="center" horizontalAlignment="center">
        <label text="Second Tab Content"></label>
      </ContentView>
    </GridLayout>
  </StackLayout>
  <StackLayout *tabItem="{title: 'Third'}">
    <GridLayout>
      <ContentView verticalAlignment="center" horizontalAlignment="center">
        <label text="Third Tab Content"></label>
      </ContentView>
    </GridLayout>
  </StackLayout>
</TabView>
```

tsx

```
<tabView>
  <tabViewItem nodeRole="items" title="First">
    <label
      text="First Tab Content"
      textAlignment="center"
      verticalAlignment="middle"
    ></label>
  </tabViewItem>
  <tabViewItem nodeRole="items" title="Second">
    <label
      text="Second Tab Content"
      textAlignment="center"
      verticalAlignment="middle"
    ></label>
  </tabViewItem>
  <tabViewItem nodeRole="items" title="Third">
    <label
      text="Third Tab Content"
      textAlignment="center"
      verticalAlignment="middle"
    ></label>
  </tabViewItem>
</tabView>
```

tsx

```
<tabview>
  <tabviewitem title="First">
    <label
      text="First Tab Content"
      textAlignment="center"
      verticalAlignment="center"
    ></label>
  </tabviewitem>
  <tabviewitem title="Second">
    <label
      text="Second Tab Content"
      textAlignment="center"
      verticalAlignment="center"
    ></label>
  </tabviewitem>
  <tabviewitem title="Third">
    <label
      text="Third Tab Content"
      textAlignment="center"
      verticalAlignment="center"
    ></label>
  </tabviewitem>
</tabview>
```

svelte

```
<tabView>
  <tabViewItem title="First">
    <label
      text="First Tab Content"
      textAlignment="center"
      verticalAlignment="center"
    ></label>
  </tabViewItem>
  <tabViewItem title="Second">
    <label
      text="Second Tab Content"
      textAlignment="center"
      verticalAlignment="center"
    ></label>
  </tabViewItem>
  <tabViewItem title="Third">
    <label
      text="Third Tab Content"
      textAlignment="center"
      verticalAlignment="center"
    ></label>
  </tabViewItem>
</tabView>
```

vue

```
<TabView>
  <TabViewItem title="First">
    <Label text="First Tab Content" textAlignment="center" verticalAlignment="center"></Label>
  </TabViewItem>
  <TabViewItem title="Second">
    <Label text="Second Tab Content" textAlignment="center" verticalAlignment="center"></Label>
  </TabViewItem>
  <TabViewItem title="Third">
    <Label text="Third Tab Content" textAlignment="center" verticalAlignment="center"></Label>
  </TabViewItem>
</TabView>
```

## Props [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/tab-view\#props)

### selectedIndex [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/tab-view\#selectedindex)

ts

```
selectedIndex: number
```

Gets or sets the currently selected tab.

Defaults to `0`.

### tabTextColor [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/tab-view\#tabtextcolor)

xml

```
tabTextColor: Color
```

Gets or sets the text color of the tab titles.

Corresponding CSS property:

css

```
.tab-view {
  tab-text-color: #fff;
}
```

See [Color](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/class/Color).

### tabTextFontSize [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/tab-view\#tabtextfontsize)

ts

```
tabTextFontSize: number
```

Gets or sets the font size of the tab titles.

Corresponding CSS property:

css

```
.tab-view {
  tab-text-font-size: 24;
}
```

### tabBackgroundColor [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/tab-view\#tabbackgroundcolor)

ts

```
tabBackgroundColor: Color
```

Sets the background color of the tabs.

Corresponding CSS property:

css

```
.tab-view {
  tab-background-color: #3d5a80;
}
```

See [Color](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/class/Color).

### androidSelectedTabHighlightColor [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/tab-view\#androidselectedtabhighlightcolor)

ts

```
androidSelectedTabHighlightColor: Color
```

Sets the underline color of the tabs. **Android only.**

Corresponding CSS property:

css

```
.tab-view {
   android-selected-tab-highlight-color:: #3d5a80;
}
```

See [Color](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/class/Color).

### androidTabsPosition [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/tab-view\#androidtabsposition)

ts

```
androidTabsPosition: 'top' | 'bottom'
```

Sets the position of the tabs. **Android only.**

Defaults to `top`.

### iosIconRenderingMode [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/tab-view\#iosiconrenderingmode)

ts

```
iosIconRenderingMode: 'automatic' | 'alwaysOriginal' | 'alwaysTemplate'
```

Gets or sets the icon rendering mode on iOS. **iOS only.**

Defaults to `automatic`.

See [UIImage.RenderingMode](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/uikit/uiimage/renderingmode).

### ...Inherited [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/tab-view\#inherited)

For additional inherited properties, refer to the [API Reference](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/class/TabView).

## TabViewItem Props [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/tab-view\#tabviewitem-props)

### title [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/tab-view\#title)

ts

```
title: string
```

Gets or sets the title of the tab strip entry.

### textTransform [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/tab-view\#texttransform)

ts

```
textTransform: TextTransformType // "initial" | "none" | "capitalize" | "uppercase" | "lowercase"
```

Gets or sets the text transform.

See [TextTransformType](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/namespace/CoreTypes#texttransformtype).

Defaults to `initial`.

### iconSource [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/tab-view\#iconsource)

ts

```
iconSource: string
```

Gets or sets the icon source of the tab strip entry.

Supported paths are `res://` or an absolute path (eg. `~/assets/image.png`).

See [`Image`](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/image) for details on the different paths.

## Events [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/tab-view\#events)

### selectedIndexChange [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/tab-view\#selectedindexchange)

ts

```
on('selectedIndexChanged', (args: EventData) => {
  const tabView = args.object as TabView
  console.log('TabView selectedIndex:', tabView.selectedIndex)
})
```

Emitted when the selected tab changes.

## Native component [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/tab-view\#native-component)

- Android: [`androidx.viewpager.widget.ViewPager`](https://developer.android.com/reference/androidx/viewpager/widget/ViewPager)
- iOS: [`UITabBarController`](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/uikit/uitabbarcontroller)

Next [TextField‚Üí](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-field)

  - [Progress](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/progress)
  - [ScrollView](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/scroll-view)
  - [SearchBar](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/search-bar)
  - [SegmentedBar](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/segmented-bar)
  - [Slider](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/slider)
  - [Switch](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/switch)
  - [TabView](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/tab-view)
  - [TextField](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-field)
  - [TextView](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-view)
  - [TimePicker](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/time-picker)
  - [WebView](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/web-view)

The `<AbsoluteLayout>` container is the simplest layout container in NativeScript.

`<AbsoluteLayout>` has the following behavior:

- Uses a pair of absolute top/left coordinates to position its children.
- Doesn't enforce any layout constraints on its children.
- Doesn't resize its children at runtime when its size changes.

### Creating a simple grid-like layout [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/absolute-layout\#creating-a-simple-grid-like-layout)

The following example creates a simple grid.

xml

```
<AbsoluteLayout backgroundColor="#eef7ff">
  <Label
    text="10, 10"
    left="10"
    top="10"
    width="100"
    height="100"
    backgroundColor="#43b2f4"
  />
  <Label
    text="120, 10"
    left="120"
    top="10"
    width="100"
    height="100"
    backgroundColor="#43b2f4"
  />
  <Label
    text="10, 120"
    left="10"
    top="120"
    width="100"
    height="100"
    backgroundColor="#43b2f4"
  />
  <Label
    text="120, 120"
    left="120"
    top="120"
    width="100"
    height="100"
    backgroundColor="#43b2f4"
  />
</AbsoluteLayout>
```

![](https://art.nativescript.org/layouts/absolute_layout_grid.svg)

Note

This example shows building a grid-like layout, this mainly serves as an example to illustrate how `<AbsoluteLayout>` works. In most cases building this UI will be better served by using a [GridLayout](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/grid-layout).

### Overlapping elements [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/absolute-layout\#overlapping-elements)

The following example creates a group of overlapping items.

xml

```
<AbsoluteLayout backgroundColor="#eef7ff">
  <Label
    text="10, 10"
    left="10"
    top="10"
    width="100"
    height="100"
    backgroundColor="#0089ca"
  />
  <Label
    text="30, 40"
    left="30"
    top="40"
    width="100"
    height="100"
    backgroundColor="#43b2f4"
  />
</AbsoluteLayout>
```

![](https://art.nativescript.org/layouts/absolute_layout_overlap.svg)

Note

If you need to build more complex UIs with overlapping elements, consider using a [GridLayout](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/grid-layout) for greater flexibility.

## AbsoluteLayout Reference [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/absolute-layout\#absolutelayout-reference)

### Props [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/absolute-layout\#props)

| Name | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| `N/A` | `N/A` | None. |
| `...Inherited` | `Inherited` | Additional inherited properties not shown. Refer to the [API Reference](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/class/AbsoluteLayout) |

### Children props [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/absolute-layout\#children-props)

When an element is a direct child of `<AbsoluteLayout>`, you can set the following additional properties.

| Name | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| `top` | `Number` | Gets or sets the distance, in pixels, between the top edge of the child and the top edge of its parent. |
| `left` | `Number` | Gets or sets the distance, in pixels, between the left edge of the child and the left edge of its parent. |

Previous [‚ÜêDockLayout](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/dock-layout)

Next [Navigation Components‚Üí](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/#navigation-containers)

On this page

1. ‚Üë Top
2. [Creating a simple grid-like layout](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/absolute-layout#creating-a-simple-grid-like-layout)
3. [Overlapping elements](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/absolute-layout#overlapping-elements)
4. [AbsoluteLayout Reference](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/absolute-layout#absolutelayout-reference)
1. [Props](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/absolute-layout#props)
2. [Children props](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/absolute-layout#children-props)

## TextField UI Component

Menu

  - [TimePicker](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/time-picker)
  - [WebView](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/web-view)

`<TextField>` is a UI component for single-line text entry.

For multi-line text input, see [TextView](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-view).

![](https://docs.nativescript.org/assets/TextField.a6e62c8a.png)

![](https://docs.nativescript.org/assets/TextField.7013f9a0.png)

TypeScript

Angular
Angular
Vue.js
Vue
Svelte
Svelte
Solid
Solid

React

xml

```
<TextField hint="Placeholder..." />
```

```
<TextField hint="Placeholder..." />
```

tsx

```
<textField hint="Type here" />
```

tsx

```
<textfield hint="Placeholder..." />
```

```
<textField hint="Placeholder..." />
```

```
<TextField hint="Placeholder..." />
```

## Examples [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-field\#examples)

### Formatting text inside a TextField [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-field\#formatting-text-inside-a-textfield)

If you need to style parts of the text, you can use a combination of a `FormattedString` and `Span` elements.

xml

```
<TextField>
  <FormattedString>
    <Span text="This text has a " />
    <Span text="red " style="color: red" />
    <Span text="piece of text. " />
    <Span text="Also, this bit is italic, " fontStyle="italic" />
    <Span text="and this bit is bold." fontWeight="bold" />
  </FormattedString>
</TextField>
```

## Props [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-field\#props)

### text [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-field\#text)

ts

```
text: string
```

Gets or sets the `text` of the TextField.

### hint [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-field\#hint)

ts

```
hint: string
```

Gets or sets the placeholder text for the TextField.

### editable [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-field\#editable)

ts

```
editable: boolean
```

When set to `false` the TextField is read-only.

Defaults to `true`.

### keyboardType [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-field\#keyboardtype)

ts

```
keyboardType: CoreTypes.KeyboardType | number // "datetime" | "email" | "integer" | "number" | "phone" | "url"
```

Gets or sets the keyboard type shown when editing this TextField.

On iOS, any valid `UIKeyboardType` number works, for example:

ts

```
keyboardType = 8 // UIKeyboardType.DecimalPad
```

See [CoreTypes.KeyboardType](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/namespace/CoreTypes-KeyboardType), [UIKeyboardType](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/uikit/uikeyboardtype?language=objc).

### returnKeyType [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-field\#returnkeytype)

ts

```
returnKeyType: CoreTypes.ReturnKeyType // "done" | "go" | "next" | "search" | "send"
```

Gets or sets the label of the return key.

See [CoreTypes.ReturnKeyType](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/namespace/CoreTypes-ReturnKeyType).

### isEnabled [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-field\#isenabled)

Allows disabling the TextField. A disabled TextField does not react to user gestures or input.

Default value is `true`.

### maxLength [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-field\#maxlength)

ts

```
maxLength: number
```

Limits input to the specified number of characters.

### secure [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-field\#secure)

ts

```
secure: boolean
```

Hides the entered text when `true`. Useful for password input fields.

Defaults to `false`.

### secureWithoutAutofill [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-field\#securewithoutautofill)

ts

```
secureWithoutAutofill: boolean
```

Prevents iOS 12+ auto suggested strong password handling. **iOS only**

Defaults to `false`.

### autocapitalizationType [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-field\#autocapitalizationtype)

ts

```
autocapitalizationType: CoreTypes.AutocapitalizationType // "allCharacters" | "none" | "sentences" | "words"
```

Gets or sets the autocapitalization type.

See [CoreTypes.AutocapitalizationType](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/namespace/CoreTypes-AutocapitalizationType)

### ...Inherited [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-field\#inherited)

For additional inherited properties, refer to the [API Reference](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/class/TextField).

## Methods [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-field\#methods)

### focus() [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-field\#focus)

ts

```
focus(): boolean
```

Focuses the TextField and returns `true` if the focus was succeessful.

### dismissSoftInput() [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-field\#dismisssoftinput)

ts

```
dismissSoftInput(): void
```

Hides the on-screen keyboard.

## Events [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-field\#events)

### textChange [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-field\#textchange)

ts

```
on('textChange', (args: PropertyChangeData) => {
  const textField = args.object as TextField
  console.log('TextField text changed:', args.value)
})
```

Emitted when the input text changes.

Event data type: [PropertyChangeData](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/interface/PropertyChangeData)

### returnPress [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-field\#returnpress)

ts

```
on('returnPress', (args: EventData) => {
  const textField = args.object as TextField
  console.log('TextField return key pressed.')
})
```

Emitted when the return key is pressed.

### focus [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-field\#focus-1)

ts

```
on('focus', (args: EventData) => {
  const textField = args.object as TextField
  console.log('TextField has been focused')
})
```

Emitted when the TextField gains focus.

### blur [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-field\#blur)

ts

```
on('blur', (args: EventData) => {
  const textField = args.object as TextField
  console.log('TextField has been blured')
})
```

Emitted when the TextField loses focus.

## Native component [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-field\#native-component)

- Android: [`android.widget.EditText`](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/widget/EditText.html)
- iOS: [`UITextField`](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/uikit/uitextfield)

`<ListPicker>` is a UI component that lets the user select a value from a pre-configured list.

![](https://docs.nativescript.org/assets/ListPicker.77e993a9.png)

![](https://docs.nativescript.org/assets/ListPicker.efcd6faa.png)

TypeScript
TypeScript
Angular
Angular
Vue.js
Vue
Svelte
Svelte
Solid
Solid
React
React

XMLTypeScript

xml

```
<ListPicker items="{{ items }}" />
```

ts

```
const items = [`First`, `Second`, `Third`]
```

HTMLTypeScript

html

```
<ListPicker [items]="items" />
```

ts

```
items = [`First`, `Second`, `Third`];
```

tsx

```
<listPicker items={items} />
```

tsx

```
<listpicker items={choices}></listpicker>
```

svelte

```
<listPicker {items}></listPicker>
```

vue

```
<ListPicker :items="items" />
```

## Props [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/list-picker\#props)

### items [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/list-picker\#items)

ts

```
items: Array<string | number>
```

Gets or sets the items of the ListPicker.

### selectedIndex [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/list-picker\#selectedindex)

ts

```
selectedIndex: number
```

Gets or sets the index of the currently selected item.

### ...Inherited [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/list-picker\#inherited)

For additional inherited properties, refer to the [API Reference](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/class/ListPicker).

## Events [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/list-picker\#events)

### selectedIndexChange [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/list-picker\#selectedindexchange)

ts

```
on('selectedIndexChange', (args: PropertyChangeData) => {
  const picker = args.object as ListPicker
  console.log('selectedIndex changed to', args.value)
  // or picker.selectedIndex
})
```

Emitted when the currently selected item (index) changes.

## Native component [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/list-picker\#native-component)

- Android: [`android.widget.NumberPicker`](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/widget/NumberPicker.html)
- iOS: [`UIPickerView`](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/uikit/uipickerview)

Next [ListView‚Üí](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/list-view)

## Image Source Guide

ImageSource provides a common interface over ( [android.graphics.Bitmap](http://developer.android.com/reference/android/graphics/Bitmap.html) for Android and [UIImage](https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/UIKit/Reference/UIImage_Class) for iOS, allowing you to create an images from URLs, local files, base64 strings, etc.

## How to use the ImageSource class [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#how-to-use-the-imagesource-class)

The following sections demonstrate how to create an ImageSource from different sources.

### Load an image using a resource name [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#load-an-image-using-a-resource-name)

To load an image from the [App\_Resources](https://docs.nativescript.org/project-structure/app-resources) folder, use the [fromResource](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source#fromresource) or [fromResourceSync](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source#fromresourcesync) method:

ts

```
ImageSource.fromResource('logo')
  .then((image: ImageSource) => {
    console.log(image.width)
  })
  .catch((err) => {
    console.error(err.stack)
  })
```

### Load an image from the device file system [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#load-an-image-from-the-device-file-system)

To load an image from a file, use any of [fromFile](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source#fromfile), [fromFileOrResourceSync](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source#fromfileorresourcesync) or the [fromFileSync](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source#fromfilesync) method:

ts

```
async function loadImage(){

  try {
    const imageFromFile: ImageSource = await ImageSource.fromFile(filePath)

  } catch (error) {

  }
```

### Create an image from a base64 string [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#create-an-image-from-a-base64-string)

To create an image from a base64 string, use the [fromBase64](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source#tobase64string) or [fromBase64Sync](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source#frombase64sync) method:

ts

```
const base64Str = 'some base64Str'
const image: ImageSource = ImageSource.fromBase64Sync(base64Str)
```

### Create an ImageSource from a font icon code [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#create-an-imagesource-from-a-font-icon-code)

ts

```
const font = new Font('sans serif')
const color = new Color('black')
const imageSource: ImageSource = ImageSource.fromFontIconCodeSync(
  '\uf004',
  font,
  color,
)
```

### Save an image to a file on the File System [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#save-an-image-to-a-file-on-the-file-system)

To save an ImageSource instance to a file, call the [saveToFile](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source#savetofile) or [saveToFileAsync](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source#savetofileasync) method on the instance.

ts

```
async function saveImage() {
  try {
    const folderDest: Folder = knownFolders.documents()

    folderDest.getFile('/images/test.png') //1. Create the file

    const pathDest = path.join(folderDest.path, '/images/test.png')
    const saved: boolean = await image.saveToFileAsync(pathDest, 'png') // Save to the file
    if (saved) {
      Dialogs.alert('Saved successfully')
    }
  } catch (err) {
    Dialogs.alert(err)
  }
}
```

## ImageSource API [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#imagesource-api)

### constructor() [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#constructor)

ts

```
const imageSource = new ImageSource(nativeSource)
```

Creates a new ImageSource instance and sets the provided native source object. `nativeSource` object will update either the android or ios properties, depending on the target platform.

* * *

The ImageSource class provides the following image static methods loaders.

### fromAsset() [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#fromasset)

ts

```
ImageSource.fromAsset(asset: ImageAsset)
.then((imageSource: ImageSource) =>{
// handle the created image
})
.catch(error =>{
    // handle errror
})
```

Loads an ImageSource instance from the specified [ImageAsset](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/) instance asynchronously.

* * *

### fromBase64() [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#frombase64)

ts

```
ImageSource.fromBase64(base64String)
  .then((imageSource: ImageSource) => {
    // handle the created image
  })
  .catch((error) => {
    // handle errror
  })
```

Loads an ImageSource instance from the specified base64 encoded string asynchronously

* * *

### fromBase64Sync() [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#frombase64sync)

ts

```
const imageSource: ImageSource = ImageSource.fromBase64Sync(base64String)
```

Loads an ImageSource instance from the specified base64 encoded string synchronously.

* * *

### fromData() [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#fromdata)

ts

```
ImageSource.fromData(data)
  .then((imageSource: ImageSource) => {
    // handle the created image
  })
  .catch((error) => {
    // handle errror
  })
```

Asynchronously loads an ImageSource instance from the specified native image data(byte array) asynchronously. `data` can be a Stream on Android or [NSData](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/foundation/nsdata) on iOS.

* * *

### fromDataSync() [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#fromdatasync)

ts

```
const imageSource: ImageSource = ImageSource.fromDataSync(data)
```

Loads an ImageSource instance from the specified native image data(byte array).

* * *

### fromFile() [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#fromfile)

ts

```
ImageSource.fromFile(path)
  .then((imageSource: ImageSource) => {
    // handle the created image
  })
  .catch((error) => {
    // handle errror
  })
```

Loads an ImageSource instance from the specified file asynchronously.

* * *

### fromFileSync() [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#fromfilesync)

ts

```
const imageSource: ImageSource = ImageSource.fromFileSync(data)
```

Loads an ImageSource instance from the specified file.

### fromFileOrResourceSync() [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#fromfileorresourcesync)

ts

```
const imageSource: ImageSource = ImageSource.fromFileOrResourceSync(path)
```

Create an ImageSource from the specified local file or resource (if specified with the `"res://"` prefix).

* * *

### fromFontIconCodeSync() [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#fromfonticoncodesync)

ts

```
const imageSource: ImageSource = ImageSource.fromFontIconCodeSync(
  source,
  font,
  color,
)
```

Creates a new ImageSource instance from the specified font icon code.

- `source`: The unicode string.
- `font`: Font instance.
- `color`: Color instance.

* * *

### fromResource() [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#fromresource)

ts

```
ImageSource.fromResource(name)
  .then((imageSource: ImageSource) => {
    // handle the created image
  })
  .catch((error) => {
    // handle errror
  })
```

Creates an ImageSource from the specified resource name(without the extension) asynchronously.

* * *

### fromResourceSync() [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#fromresourcesync)

ts

```
const imageSource: ImageSource = ImageSource.fromResourceSync(name)
```

Creates an ImageSource from the specified resource name(without the extension) synchronously.

* * *

### fromUrl() [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#fromurl)

ts

```
ImageSource.fromUrl(url)
  .then((imageSource: ImageSource) => {
    // handle the created image
  })
  .catch((error) => {
    // handle errror
  })
```

Downloads and decodes the image from the provided url and creates a new ImageSource instance from it.

* * *

#### The loaded ImageSource instance has the following properties and methods. [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#the-loaded-imagesource-instance-has-the-following-properties-and-methods)

### android [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#android)

ts

```
imageAndroid: android.graphics.BitMap = imageSource.android
```

The Android-specific( [Bitmap](http://developer.android.com/reference/android/graphics/Bitmap.html)) instance.

* * *

### ios [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#ios)

ts

```
imageIOS: UIImage = imageSource.ios
```

The iOS-specific( [UIImage](https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/UIKit/Reference/UIImage_Class/)) instance.

* * *

### height [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#height)

ts

```
height: number = imageSource.height
```

Gets the height of the instance.

* * *

### width [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#width)

ts

```
width: number = imageSource.width
```

Gets the width of the instance.

* * *

### rotationAngle [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#rotationangle)

ts

```
rotationAngle: number = imageSource.rotationAngle
```

`Android-only`: Gets or sets the rotation angle that should be applied to the image.

* * *

### resizeAsync() [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#resizeasync)

ts

```
imageSource
  .resize(maxSize, options)
  .then((resizedImage: ImageSource) => {})
  .catch((error) => {})
```

Asynchronously returns a new ImageSource that is a resized version of the imageSource with the same aspect ratio, and the max dimension set to the provided maxSize.

- `maxSize` is the maximum desired pixel dimension of the resulting image.
- _Optional_: ( `Android` only) `options.filter` options.filter is a `boolean` which determines whether or not bilinear filtering should be used when scaling the bitmap. If `true` then bilinear filtering will be used when scaling which has better image quality at the cost of worse performance. If this is false then nearest-neighbor scaling is used instead which will have worse image quality but is faster. Recommended is to set filter to 'true' as the cost of bilinear filtering is typically minimal and the improved image quality is significant.

* * *

### resize() [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#resize)

ts

```
resizedImage: ImageSource = imageSource.resize(maxSize, options)
```

Returns a new ImageSource that is a resized version of the imageSource with the same aspect ratio, and the max dimension set to the provided `maxSize`.

* * *

### saveToFile() [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#savetofile)

ts

```
isSaved: boolean = imageSource.saveToFile(path, format, quality)
```

Saves this instance to the specified file, using the provided image `format` and `quality`.

* * *

### saveToFileAsync() [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#savetofileasync)

ts

```
imageSource
  .saveToFileAsync(path, format, quality)
  .then((isSaved: boolean) => {})
  .catch((error) => {})
```

Asynchronously saves this instance to the specified file, using the provided image `format` and `quality`.

- `path` ( `string`) is the path of the file on the file system to save to.
- `format` ( `'png' | 'jpeg' | 'jpg'`) is the format (encoding) of the image.
- _Optional_: `quality` specifies the quality of the encoding. It defaults to the maximum available quality, and varies on a scale of 0 to 100.

* * *

### setNativeSource() [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#setnativesource)

ts

```
imageSource.setNativeSource(nativeSource)
```

Sets the provided native source object, either a Bitmap for Android or a UIImage for iOS.

* * *

### toBase64String() [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#tobase64string)

ts

```
base64String: string = imageSource.toBase64String(format, quality)
```

Converts the image to base64 encoded string, using the provided image format and quality.

* * *

### toBase64StringAsync() [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#tobase64stringasync)

ts

```
imageSource
  .toBase64StringAsync(format, quality)
  .then((base64String: string) => {})
  .catch((error) => {})
```

Asynchronously converts the image to base64 encoded string, using the provided image format and quality.

## API Reference(s) [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#api-reference-s)

- [ImageSource](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/class/ImageSource) class

## Native Component [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/core/image-source\#native-component)

- `android`: [android.graphics.Bitmap](http://developer.android.com/reference/android/graphics/Bitmap.html)
- `iOS`: [UIImage](https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/UIKit/Reference/UIImage_Class)

  - [TimePicker](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/time-picker)
  - [WebView](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/web-view)

`<DatePicker>` is a UI component that lets users select a date from a pre-configured range.

See also: [TimePicker](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/time-picker).

![](https://docs.nativescript.org/assets/DatePicker.e7b011a6.png)

![](https://docs.nativescript.org/assets/DatePicker.99bb06af.png)

TypeScript
TypeScript
Angular
Angular
Vue.js
Vue
Svelte
Svelte
Solid
Solid
React
React

xml

```
<DatePicker
  year="2023"
  month="8"
  day="28"
  date="{{ date }}"
  minDate="{{ minDate }}"
  maxDate="{{ maxDate }}"
/>
```

html

```
<DatePicker
  year="2023"
  month="8"
  day="28"
  [date]="date"
  [minDate]="minDate"
  [maxDate]="maxDate"
/>
```

tsx

```
<datePicker date={date}></datePicker>
```

tsx

```
<datepicker date={date}></datepicker>
```

svelte

```
<datepicker bind:date={value}></datepicker>
```

vue

```
<DatePicker :date="date" />
```

## Props [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/date-picker\#props)

### date [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/date-picker\#date)

ts

```
date: Date
```

Gets or sets the complete date.

### minDate [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/date-picker\#mindate)

ts

```
minDate: Date
```

Gets or sets the earliest possible date to select.

### maxDate [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/date-picker\#maxdate)

ts

```
maxDate: Date
```

Gets or sets the latest possible date to select.

### day [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/date-picker\#day)

ts

```
day: number
```

Gets or sets the day of the month.

### month [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/date-picker\#month)

ts

```
month: number
```

Gets or sets the month.

### year [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/date-picker\#year)

ts

```
year: number
```

Gets or sets the year.

### iosPreferredDatePickerStyle [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/date-picker\#iospreferreddatepickerstyle)

ts

```
iosPreferredDatePickerStyle: UIDatePickerStyle
```

Gets or set the UIDatePickerStyle of the DatePicker in iOS `13.4+`.

Default value: `0` (automatic).

Valid values:

- `0 = automatic`: system picks the concrete style based on the current platform and DatePicker mode.
- `1 = wheels`: the DatePicker displays as a wheel picker.
- `2 = compact` : the DatePicker displays as a label that when tapped displays a calendar-style editor.
- `3 = inline` : the DatePickers displays as an inline, editable field

## Events [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/date-picker\#events)

### dateChange [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/date-picker\#datechange)

ts

```
on('dateChange', (args: PropertyChangeData) => {
  const picker = args.object as DatePicker
  console.log('New date:', args.value)
})
```

Emitted when the selected date changes.

See [PropertyChangeData](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/interface/PropertyChangeData).

### minDateChange [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/date-picker\#mindatechange)

ts

```
on('minDateChange', (args: PropertyChangeData) => {
  const picker = args.object as DatePicker
  console.log('New minDate:', args.value)
})
```

Emitted when the minimum date changes.

See [PropertyChangeData](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/interface/PropertyChangeData).

### maxDateChange [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/date-picker\#maxdatechange)

ts

```
on('maxDateChange', (args: PropertyChangeData) => {
  const picker = args.object as DatePicker
  console.log('New maxDate:', args.value)
})
```

Emitted when the maximum date changes.

See [PropertyChangeData](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/interface/PropertyChangeData).

### dayChange [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/date-picker\#daychange)

ts

```
on('dayChange', (args: PropertyChangeData) => {
  const picker = args.object as DatePicker
  console.log('New day:', args.value)
})
```

Emitted when the day changes.

See [PropertyChangeData](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/interface/PropertyChangeData).

### monthChange [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/date-picker\#monthchange)

ts

```
on('monthChange', (args: PropertyChangeData) => {
  const picker = args.object as DatePicker
  console.log('New month:', args.value)
})
```

Emitted when the month changes.

See [PropertyChangeData](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/interface/PropertyChangeData).

### yearChange [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/date-picker\#yearchange)

ts

```
on('yearChange', (args: PropertyChangeData) => {
  const picker = args.object as DatePicker
  console.log('New year:', args.value)
})
```

Emitted when the year changes.

See [PropertyChangeData](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/interface/PropertyChangeData).

## Native component [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/date-picker\#native-component)

- Android: [`android.widget.DatePicker`](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/widget/DatePicker.html)
- iOS: [`UIDatePicker`](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/uikit/uidatepicker)

  - [WebView](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/web-view)

`<WebView>` is a UI component for rendering web content. The content can be from a remote URL, a local file, or an inline string.

See also: [HtmlView](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/html-view).

![](https://docs.nativescript.org/assets/WebView.ee7d2fc5.png)

![](https://docs.nativescript.org/assets/WebView.a6723cb4.png)

TypeScript
TypeScript
Angular
Angular
Vue.js
Vue
Svelte
Svelte
Solid
Solid
React
React

xml

```
<WebView src="https://nativescript.org/" />
```

html

```
<WebView src="https://nativescript.org/" />
```

tsx

```
<webView src="https://nativescript.org/" />
```

tsx

```
<webview src="https://nativescript.org/" />
```

svelte

```
<webView src="https://nativescript.org/" />
```

vue

```
<WebView src="https://nativescript.org/" />
```

Tip

To be able to use gestures inside a WebView on Android, [disable zoom controls](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/web-view#disableZoom).

## Props [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/web-view\#props)

### src [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/web-view\#src)

ts

```
src: string
```

The source to load in the WebView. The value can be a valid HTTP URL, a path to a local HTML file, or a HTML string.

**Example:**

ts

```
webView.src = 'https://nativescript.org/'
webView.src = '~/assets/html/index.html'
webView.src = '<div><h1>Some static HTML</h1></div>'
```

Insecure URLs

Depending on the software version of the device, insecure URLs may be blocked ( `http://`), it's recommended to always use secure URLs ( `https://`).

### canGoBack [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/web-view\#cangoback)

ts

```
canGoBack: boolean
```

Gets a value indicating whether the WebView can navigate back.

### canGoForward [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/web-view\#cangoforward)

ts

```
canGoForward: boolean
```

Gets a value indicating whether the WebView can navigate forward.

### disableZoom [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/web-view\#disableZoom)

ts

```
disableZoom: boolean
```

Disable zooming in the WebView.

### iosAllowInlineMediaPlayback [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/web-view\#iosallowinlinemediaplayback)

ts

```
iosAllowInlineMediaPlayback: boolean
```

Enables inline media playback on iOS. By default, WebView forces iPhone into fullscreen media playback. **iOS only.**

### ...Inherited [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/web-view\#inherited)

For additional inherited properties not shown, refer to the [API Reference](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/class/WebView)

## Methods [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/web-view\#methods)

### stopLoading() [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/web-view\#stoploading)

ts

```
stopLoading(): void
```

Stops loading the current content (if any).

### goBack() [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/web-view\#goback)

ts

```
goBack(): void
```

Navigates the WebView back.

### goForward() [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/web-view\#goforward)

ts

```
goForward(): void
```

Navigates the WebView forward.

### reload() [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/web-view\#reload)

ts

```
reload(): void
```

Reloads the current url.

## Events [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/web-view\#events)

### loadStarted [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/web-view\#loadstarted)

ts

```
on('loadStarted', (args: EventData) => {
  const webView = arg.object as WebView

  console.log('WebView started loading', args.url)
})
```

Emitted when the page has started loading in the `<WebView>`.

See [LoadEventData](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/interface/LoadEventData).

### loadFinished [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/web-view\#loadfinished)

ts

```
on('loadFinished', (args: EventData) => {
  const webView = arg.object as WebView

  console.log('WebView finished loading', args.url)
})
```

Emitted when the page has started loading in the `<WebView>`.

See [LoadEventData](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/interface/LoadEventData).

## Native component [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/web-view\#native-component)

- Android: [`android.webkit.WebView`](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/webkit/WebView)
- iOS: [`WKWebView`](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/webkit/wkwebview)

  - [TimePicker](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/time-picker)

`<ActivityIndicator>` is a UI component that shows a progress indicator signaling to the user of an operation running in the background.

![](https://docs.nativescript.org/assets/ActivityIndicator.2ff82fef.png)

![](https://docs.nativescript.org/assets/ActivityIndicator.bb1d04f9.png)

## Examples [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/activity-indicator\#examples)

### Always busy ActivityIndicator [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/activity-indicator\#always-busy-activityindicator)

TypeScript
TypeScript
Angular
Angular
Vue.js
Vue
Svelte
Svelte
Solid
Solid
React
React

vue

```
<ActivityIndicator busy="true" />
```

xml

```
<ActivityIndicator busy="true" />
```

html

```
<ActivityIndicator busy="true" />
```

svelte

```
<activityIndicator busy="true" />
```

tsx

```
<activityIndicator busy="true" />
```

tsx

```
<activityindicator busy="true" />
```

## Props [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/activity-indicator\#props)

### busy [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/activity-indicator\#busy)

ts

```
busy: boolean
```

Gets or sets whether the indicator is busy.

### iosIndicatorViewStyle 8.9+ [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/activity-indicator\#iosindicatorviewstyle-8-9)

ts

```
iosIndicatorViewStyle: IOSIndicatorViewStyle = 'medium' | 'large'
```

Specifies the style of the indicator. This property is iOS specific.

Valid values: `medium` and `large`.

Default value: `medium`.

* * *

### ...Inherited [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/activity-indicator\#inherited)

For additional inherited properties, refer to the [API Reference](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/class/ActivityIndicator).

## Events [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/activity-indicator\#events)

### busyChange [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/activity-indicator\#busychange)

ts

```
on('busyChange', (args: EventData) => {
  const indicator = args.object as ActivityIndicator
  console.log(`indicator.busy changed to: ${indicator.busy}`)
})
```

Emitted when the busy property changes.

See [EventData](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/interface/EventData).

## Native component [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/activity-indicator\#native-component)

- Android: [`android.widget.ProgressBar` (indeterminate = true)](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/widget/ProgressBar.html)
- iOS: [`UIActivityIndicatorView`](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/uikit/uiactivityindicatorview)

## WrapLayout Overview
[**üöÄ 8.9 Released!** ‚Üí ‚ö°Ô∏è New Node-API Engine Preview, üì≤ ns widget ios, üíÖ Tailwind v4 and more...\\

Menu

- [Layout Containers](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/#layout-containers)

  - [Login](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/dialogs#login)

  - [ActivityIndicator](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/activity-indicator)
  - [Button](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/button)
  - [DatePicker](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/date-picker)

  - [Image](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/image)

  - [SearchBar](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/search-bar)
  - [SegmentedBar](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/segmented-bar)
  - [Slider](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/slider)
  - [Switch](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/switch)
  - [TabView](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/tab-view)
  - [TextField](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-field)
  - [TextView](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-view)
  - [TimePicker](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/time-picker)
  - [WebView](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/web-view)

`<WrapLayout>` is a layout container that lets you position items in rows or columns, based on the `orientation` property. When the space is filled, the container automatically wraps items onto a new row or column.

## Examples [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/wrap-layout\#examples)

### Horizontal WrapLayout [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/wrap-layout\#horizontal-wraplayout)

By default, a `WrapLayout` wraps its child items along a row. The following example creates a row of equally-sized items. When the row runs out of space, the container wraps the last item to a new row.

xml

```
<WrapLayout backgroundColor="#3c495e">
  <Label text="first" width="30%" height="30%" backgroundColor="#43B3F4" />
  <Label text="second" width="30%" height="30%" backgroundColor="#075B88" />
  <Label text="third" width="30%" height="30%" backgroundColor="#1089CA" />
  <Label text="fourth" width="30%" height="30%" backgroundColor="#1089CA" />
</WrapLayout>
```

![](https://art.nativescript.org/layouts/wrap_layout_horizontal.svg)

### Vertical WrapLayout [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/wrap-layout\#vertical-wraplayout)

To wrap child items vertically, set the `WrapLayout`'s `orentation` property to `vertical`. The following example creates a column of equally-sized items. When the column runs out of space, the container wraps the last item to a new column.

xml

```
<WrapLayout orientation="vertical" backgroundColor="#3c495e">
  <Label text="first" width="30%" height="30%" backgroundColor="#43B3F4" />
  <Label text="second" width="30%" height="30%" backgroundColor="#075B88" />
  <Label text="third" width="30%" height="30%" backgroundColor="#1089CA" />
  <Label text="fourth" width="30%" height="30%" backgroundColor="#1089CA" />
</WrapLayout>
```

![](https://art.nativescript.org/layouts/wrap_layout_vertical.svg)

## Props [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/wrap-layout\#props)

### orientation [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/wrap-layout\#orientation)

ts

```
orientation: 'horizontal' | 'vertical'
```

Specifies the stacking direction.

Defaults to `horizontal`.

### itemWidth [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/wrap-layout\#itemwidth)

ts

```
itemWidth: number
```

Sets the width used to measure and layout each child. When not set, the item width is automatically calculated based on it's contents.

Defaults to `Number.NaN`.

### itemHeight [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/wrap-layout\#itemheight)

ts

```
itemHeight: number
```

Sets the height used to measure and layout each child. When not set, the item height is automatically calculated based on it's contents.

### ...Inherited [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/wrap-layout\#inherited)

For additional inherited properties not shown, refer to the [API Reference](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/class/WrapLayout).

Previous [‚ÜêFlexboxLayout](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/flexbox-layout)

Next [DockLayout‚Üí](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/dock-layout)

3. [Props](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/wrap-layout#props)

## Dynamic View Management
[**üöÄ 8.9 Released!** ‚Üí ‚ö°Ô∏è New Node-API Engine Preview, üì≤ ns widget ios, üíÖ Tailwind v4 and more...\\

- [Plugins](https://docs.nativescript.org/plugins/)

  - [TabView](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/tab-view)
  - [TextField](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-field)
  - [TextView](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/text-view)
  - [TimePicker](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/time-picker)
  - [WebView](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/web-view)

`<RootLayout>` is a layout container designed to be used as the primary RootLayout container for your app with a built-in API to easily control dynamic view layers. It extends a [GridLayout](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/grid-layout) so has all the features of a GridLayout, enhanced with additional APIs.

## Examples [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/root-layout\#examples)

### Using RootLayout to open dynamic popups [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/root-layout\#using-rootlayout-to-open-dynamic-popups)

xml

```
<RootLayout>
  <!-- main content -->
  <GridLayout>
    <Label
      verticalAlignment="center"
      textAlignment="center"
      text="Main content area"
    />
  </GridLayout>
</RootLayout>
```

ts

```
import { createPopupView } from './helper'
// create a dynamic popup
const view = createPopupView('#65adf1', 110, -30)
```

OpeningClosinghelper.ts

ts

```
// open the dynamic popup
getRootLayout()
  .open(view, {
    shadeCover: {
      color: '#000',
      opacity: 0.7,
      tapToClose: true,
    },
    animation: {
      enterFrom: {
        opacity: 0,
        translateY: 500,
        duration: 500,
      },
      exitTo: {
        opacity: 0,
        duration: 300,
      },
    },
  })
  .catch((ex) => console.error(ex))
```

ts

```
// close the dynamic popup
getRootLayout()
  .close(view, {
    opacity: 0,
    translate: { x: 0, y: -500 },
  })
  .catch((ex) => console.error(ex))
```

ts

```
// helper to create a popup view
export function createPopupView(
  color: string,
  size: number,
  offset: number,
): View {
  const layout = new StackLayout()
  layout.height = size
  layout.width = size
  layout.marginTop = offset
  layout.marginLeft = offset
  layout.backgroundColor = color
  layout.borderRadius = 10
  return layout
}
```

## API [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/root-layout\#api)

### getRootLayout() [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/root-layout\#getrootlayout)

ts

```
import { getRootLayout } from '@nativescript/core'

const rootLayout: RootLayout = getRootLayout()
```

Returns the reference to the `RootLayout`, or `undefined` if there's no `<RootLayout>`.

RootLayout is designed to be used as a single instance

Technically you can place multiple RootLayouts in your templates, but only the last created instance will be accessible via the `getRootLayout` method. The API has been designed to control a single instance, usually placed as the root view of your Application.

## Methods [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/root-layout\#methods)

### open() [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/root-layout\#open)

ts

```
open(view: View, options?: RootLayoutOptions): Promise<void>
```

Opens the `view` and brings it to the front by default.

See [View](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/class/View), [RootLayoutOptions](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/root-layout#rootLayoutOptions).

### bringToFront() [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/root-layout\#bringtofront)

ts

```
bringToFront(view: View, animated?: boolean): Promise<void>
```

Brings the `view` to the front if it's not already. If the view is not currently shown inside the RootLayout, the call is ignored.

See [View](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/class/View).

### close() [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/root-layout\#close)

ts

```
close(view: View, exitTo?: TransitionAnimation): Promise<void>
```

See [View](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/class/View), [TransitionAnimation](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/root-layout#transitionAnimation).

### closeAll() [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/root-layout\#closeall)

ts

```
closeAll(): Promise<void>
```

Closes all views.

### getShadeCover() [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/root-layout\#getshadecover)

ts

```
getShadeCover(): View
```

Returns the shade cover (overlay view).

## RootLayoutOptions [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/root-layout\#rootLayoutOptions)

### shadeCover [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/root-layout\#shadecover)

ts

```
shadeCover: ShadeCoverOptions
```

See [ShadeCoverOptions](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/root-layout#shadeCoverOptions).

### animation [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/root-layout\#animation)

ts

```
animation: {
  enterFrom?: TransitionAnimation,
  exitTo?: TransitionAnimation
}
```

`enterFrom` is only applied if it's the first one to be opened.

`exitFrom` is only applied if it's the last one to be closed

See [TransitionAnimation](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/root-layout#transitionAnimation).

## ShadeCoverOptions [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/root-layout\#shadeCoverOptions)

### opacity [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/root-layout\#opacity)

ts

```
opacity: number
```

### color [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/root-layout\#color)

ts

```
color: Color
```

Sets the color of the shade cover.

See [Color](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/class/Color).

### tapToClose [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/root-layout\#taptoclose)

ts

```
tapToClose: boolean
```

Allows closing by tapping on the shade cover.

### animation [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/root-layout\#animation-1)

ts

```
animation: {
  enterFrom?: TransitionAnimation,
  exitTo?: TransitionAnimation
}
```

`enterFrom` is only applied if it's the first one to be opened.

`exitFrom` is only applied if it's the last one to be closed

See [TransitionAnimation](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/root-layout#transitionAnimation).

### ignoreShadeRestore [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/root-layout\#ignoreshaderestore)

ts

```
ignoreShadeRestore: boolean
```

## TransitionAnimation [‚Äã](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/root-layout\#transitionAnimation)

ts

```
interface TransitionAnimation {
  translateX?: number
  translateY?: number
  scaleX?: number
  scaleY?: number
  rotate?: number // degrees
  opacity?: number
  duration?: number // in ms
  curve?: CoreTypes.AnimationCurve
}
```

See [CoreTypes.AnimationCurve](https://docs.nativescript.org/api/namespace/CoreTypes-AnimationCurve).

Previous [‚ÜêGridLayout](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/grid-layout)

Next [FlexboxLayout‚Üí](https://docs.nativescript.org/ui/flexbox-layout)

## DockLayout UI Guide
[**üöÄ 8.9 Released!** ‚Üí ‚ö°Ô∏è New Node-API Engine Preview, üì≤ ns widget ios, üíÖ Tailwind v4 and more...\\
Read Announcement‚Üí](https://blog.nativescript.org/nativescript-8-9-announcement)

Menu
